newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt says buys 450,000 tonnes French wheat.
newsitem.headline: Egypt says buys 450,000 tonnes French wheat.

text.p: Egypt's main commodities buyer said on Sunday he bought a total 450,000 tonnes of French wheat for delivery in February, March and April at prices ranging between $140.70 and $143.90 FOB per tonne.
Samir Shakankiri, vice-chairman of the General Authority for Supply Commodities, said he bought the wheat in nine lots of 50,000 tonnes each from the following suppliers:
-- An unnamed French firm at $141 delivery in March
-- Tradigrain at $142.35 delivery in February and March
-- Cargill at $142.75 delivery between March 1 and 31
-- Continental at $142.85 delivery between March 8 and 31
-- Soufflet at $142.90 delivery between March 1 and 31
-- Toepfer at $142.95 delivery between March 10 and 31
-- Tradigrain at $142.95 delivery between Feb 15 and Mar 31
-- Tradigrain at $143.90 delivery between Feb 15 and Mar 31
Shakankiri had originally tendered for 50,000 tonnes of French, U.S. or Australian wheat.
